France recognizes State of Palestine, Macron declares at UN
subhead: The French president, during a United Nations speech on Monday, recognized a Palestinian state, saying he would continue to fight against antisemitism, after criticism from Israel and the United States.

title: Trump touts unproven link between Tylenol use and autism
subhead: Though medical professionals broadly cite acetaminophen as among the safest painkillers to take during pregnancy, Trump insisted that 'taking Tylenol is not good' for a developing fetus. Following RFK Jr.'s talking points, he also claimed that there is 'no reason' to vaccinate newborns against Hepatitis B.

title: Tom Frieden, former CDC director: 'The US is dismantling its own health infrastructure'
subhead: The physician and former director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warns that by 2030, the new US health policy could cause the deaths of more than 14 million people.

title: Spain's Aitana Bonmatí wins women's Ballon d'Or for third consecutive year
subhead: The Ballon d'Or is the most prestigious individual prize in both men's and women's football, and Bonmatí's run of three in a row follows back-to-back victories for her Barcelona and Spain teammate Alexia Putellas. Meanwhile, France forward Ousmane Dembélé won the men's Ballon d'Or on Monday.

title: Ousmane Dembélé wins 2025 Ballon d'Or, crowning a career of highs and lows
subhead: The Paris Saint-Germain forward was named footballer of the year on Monday during a ceremony held in Paris.

Japan faces a rising wave of xenophobia
subhead: Long resistant to immigration, Japan has witnessed its foreign-born population increase rapidly. This trend has contributed to a sense of insecurity, which has spread on social media and been fueled by politicians who seize on incidents to stoke fear and rejection of foreigners.
byline: By Philippe Mesmer (Kawaguchi, Japan, special correspondent)

title: Macron's slow shift toward recognizing the State of Palestine
subhead: After expressing unwavering support for Israel, the French president gradually shifted his stance on the two-state solution following October 7, 2023, and the conflict in Gaza. This reversal will culminate in France's official recognition of the State of Palestine at the UN on September 22.
byline: By Claire Gatinois and Philippe Ricard

title: The US plan to expel hundreds of thousands of Palestinians from Gaza
